reviews.review:
i highly recomend this game because :

nice graphics
rich story
fun gameplay
great atmoshere

Previous games : Bioshock 1 and 2
Releases after : -

Similar as : unique game

I steal from : nothing particular that crosses my mind.

Bugs : None

Graphics : out dated, unreal engine.

Diffiiculty : Played on hard level which is doable but you need to search every corner and do some back tracking
for the necessary coins, ammuniation and salts

Save points : Yes, not always well positioned, sometimes i played about 30 minutes before the next autosave appeared

Linear or sandbox : Lineair

Me and my guns : pistols, machine guns, rocket launcher, sniper, shotgun and some kind of spells which give you
the opportunity to throw fire balls, stun opponents or let them fly in the air.

Side missions : There are a few for obtaining extra coins or goodies

I get better : during the game you will find more spells (they call it vigors) and some gear to upgrade your player.
Quite a lot of stuff actually.

Update V2.0 : weapons and spells can be slighty modified by buying upgrades at machines slots

My vehicle : no vehicles, only your legs

Rambo or silent assassin : it is not a stealth game so Rambo it is.

Story : well written story, no doubt

Manual : no

Heal : there is no auto heal, but you have an armor on top of your health that restores automatically when in cover.
Since i played on difficult, i invested first on my armor because it restores automatically

Play time : 30 hours fun

What i will remember : This is a marvel of game design. This is art. This is outstanding and unique. It felt like Alice in Wonderland. 
Having an active  partner throughout the game and the roller coaster experience when gliding from one floating building to the other one.

This is a top game, a milestone just like Bioshock one and two at that time

①有大半流程感觉剧情跟我没什么关系，跟着“伪老婆”走就完事。接触到伊丽莎白的“妈妈”才真正觉得进入主线，从这开始才有角色扮演的参与感。剧情到后面有点难懂，后来也是翻剧透才能弄懂。
②游戏的音乐方面很出色，特别是战斗过程中击杀的音效与BGM配搭可以说越打越嗨。
③谢谢狱长室回头看见的那个报警机器人，我差点被愉悦送走了。

Özellikle atmosferini çok beğendiğim bir oyun. Silahları ve uçma kaçma mekaniklerini sevdim. İlk oyunu karanlık atmosferden dolayı bunalıp yarıda bırakmıştım. Bunu çok beğendim.

[b]İncelemeler İçin:[/b] https://store.steampowered.com/curator/35696620

The base game is pretty good.  Interesting story, good gameplay, I liked it.  One thing I didn't like was the prevalent racism in the city of Columbia.  It's not a relevant to the story, it's never addressed, it's just there for no good reason.  Maybe it's because the game is set in the 50s but with no reflection, addressing it or anything it just sucks.  The game is also pretty short, 10h to finish the game and I played pretty slowly, picking up any trash from containers that I could find.

The DLCs aren't very good.  One is an arena mode, kill waves of enemies to get the highest score.  Burial at sea 1 didn't have enough ammo and wasn't very fun.  Half of the time I was forced to use melee attacks just because of ammo shortages.  Burial at sea 2 tries to turn an FPS shooter into a stealth game and while it's not terrible it's about as good as you could expect from a game without stealth mechanics in the base game.  You again don't get enough ammo and the DLC plays slowly because a lot of the time for story reasons you can only walk and not run.

The game was fun, I can recommend it if you get it on sale.  For full price it's a bit too short.

I'm sorry, but... I just got bored. I found the game pretty, and the controls weren't too bad, and the characters weren't flat, but I realized that I found the gameplay anemic and flat. I can't really explain it, I just got bored. I made it to finktown to see if the game would pick up, but I still just wasn't having fun. From everything I could see, I SHOULD be enjoying myself, but I found myself wishing I was playing bioshock 1 or 2 instead. So that's what I am doing.

Amazing game, great storyline and classic Bioshock play-through - VERY enjoyable.

It's an amazing game that somewhat lacks on the game-play side but makes up for it 10-fold on the story. It's such a fascinating universe to be a part of, and they did a spectacular job in getting the player to connect in the narrative. What's truly brilliant is how they weave surface-level narrative with deeper sub-plots that both work together seamlessly. There's always some deeper thing you're trying to wrap your head around while you try to complete a more focused objective -- i.e. trying to figure out what these tears are and why Elizabeth has these powers, while you try to save Chen Lin and collect the weapons for Fitzroy. It's a classic, and I highly recommend for those who like an intriguing, mysterious story.

This game was so much fun to play through, Columbia is a very bright and beautiful setting. The game play is fun and exciting, riding on rails and pouncing on my enemies was awesome, and the most of the vigors were very useful and the game did a good job at making you balance out what you used. As for the gun play, you can only hold two weapons at a time so it's best to pick what best suits your play style. I went with the sniper rifle and shotgun most of the time because I liked to pick off enemies from a distance while having a powerful close range weapon to take down anyone who got too close to me. Elizabeth, the girl who you spend most of the game with is very helpful with getting you ammo, salts(ammo for vigors), health, and money. Plus she can spawn in items or allies to help you in a battle. The main story has an excellent plot that does take some thinking to understand what is happening, but it is really interesting to learn about.

For the dlc, in my opinion it's still good but not as good as the main story, episode 1 of Burial at Sea feels not as fun as the main story since there isn't many rails for you to ride on. Episode 2 changes up the game play with making you focus on stealth first and only using combat as a last resort. I wasn't overly fancy about going all stealthy instead of fighting my enemies head on, but it paid off to have patience and not take serious amounts of damage. The story of episode 2 is better than what episode 1 starts with as it connects with the first bioshock in a satisfying way. 

Performance wise the game ran pretty good for the most part. The game had it's moments where the frame rate would drop when looking at certain actions from Elizabeth or a fireplace burning, or whenever I booted up the game and started from my last save. To be fair I do not have the greatest hardware and the frame rate never dropped during important moments of game play.

Overall the game is fantastic and in my opinion is better than the original Bioshock. If your a fan of the original games then I highly recommend you give this game a try.

Irmãos e Irmãs, parem de procurar análises negativas, pois não tem, a única coisa que pode ser negativa é que esse jogo (Bioshock Infinite) não é otimizado para PC, baguio trava nos loadings que é uma beleza. Mas esse jogo é tão ABSURDO, tão INCRÍVEL, (os três Bioshocks, são obras primas) que vale a pena a compra (comprem os 3, sério, zero arrependimentos). A história é simplesmente magnífica e muito mais complexa do que se pode imaginar. Se você curte uma trama extremamente bem elaborada com ambientação 12/10 e uma gameplay envolvendo tiro porrada e bomba (com uma pitada (BEM GRANDE) de poderes) então Bioshock é para você.

Então na moral? Compra essa maravilha que você não vai se arrepender.

The Bioshock Franchise has the best story I've seen in any franchise.
The games on their own are still very capable shooters with good stories on their own, but the way they integrate with each other into a timeline is phenomenal.
Don't just buy this game, buy the whole Bioshock Franchise, or don't buy any at all.
PS: Burial at Sea is the Best
